result.execSummary:
The defendant Vito Davinci Esperes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with K.M.B.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vito Davinci Esperes

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction; not deliverable as addressed

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vito Davinci Esperes in court. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Vito Davinci Esperes. Agreement reached. State confirms victim rights compliance. State to file Amended Information within 48 hrs. Charge amended on State's Motion to Misd Theft as PTAC per Wis Stats Sec. 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a), 939.05. Def pleads  no contest; is convicted and sentenced.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vito Davinci Esperes in court. Def believes he is eligible for SPD counsel; called the SPD office yesterday. Def reminded to report to WCSO for booking compliance as previously ordered. Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Vito Davinci Esperes appeared in court. Def states he is eligible for SPD but wanted to retain counsel instead. Witness: Detective Thomas Lichtensteiger (WBPD).  State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds def over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with KMB or Co-Def Jordan V

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Vito Davinci Esperes appeared in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Def requests timely PH. Defendant referred to State Public Defender. Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
